name: TheAtlantic
text: The new postmaster general's cost-cutting steps have led to delivery delays. The Trump administration's hostility toward USPS instigated "unnecessary and politically manufactured" crises—putting jobs and communities at risk, Philip F. Rubio wrote in April: https://t.co/hE127HhXdt

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In Biden, Democrats have a nominee who is promising FDR-style change," @PeterBeinart writes, "yet is avoiding the political backlash that an ambitious progressive agenda often brings." https://t.co/u7AnElRism

name: TheAtlantic
text:
"The happiest place on Earth" may be situated in a coronavirus hot spot, but Disney's superfans persist—even if it means donning masks in the Florida heat and feeling occasional pangs of anxiety. @shirklesxp reports:
https://t.co/Y8Gvqih4lt

name: TheAtlantic
text: A Democratic effort to help Kris Kobach win the GOP Senate nomination in Kansas is unnerving the party’s staunchest immigrant advocates, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/JFiFpXbnLp

name: TheAtlantic
text: With its first passengers, two NASA astronauts, now home from space, SpaceX predicts paying customers might make the same trip “not too long from now,” @marinakoren reports: https://t.co/1dY3YBHmXo

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Islamic State turned Facebook into a global marketplace for looted artifacts. These vigilante archaeologists are trying to stop it, @Jenna_Scatena reports. https://t.co/Yrb22NmD7V

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I’ve been hauling balloons into my apartment recently, great gaggles of them, in the interest of general mood elevation. There have been occasions, too, moments to mark: birthdays, graduations, whatever. They’re over. But the balloons remain...." https://t.co/TIy1MJ5OXc

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Archaeology operates within a contemporary setting and can contribute to conversations we are having today about how history is memorialized," @dmcarballo tells @DavidFrum: https://t.co/ghagKP3hzX

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen as @JasonWardNY joins @katlwells & @jameshamblin to guide them through a pandemic-compatible hobby: birding. https://t.co/inuJAi2M8c

name: TheAtlantic
text: Small businesses have played a big role in revitalizing towns across America—but the pandemic is straining them. @JamesFallows on two local brewing companies and how they're surviving: https://t.co/36d2IK5pv2

name: TheAtlantic
text: Cases will wax and wane over time, but this virus is never going away, @sarahzhang writes: https://t.co/Ynx9lq7Rzx

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Daily: 5 Ways America Has Failed During the Pandemic, by @mimbsy https://t.co/6lLLC0V9K4

name: TheAtlantic
text: Domestic-violence refuges are one of feminism's great successes. But have we become too hung up on "rescuing" victims, asks @helenlewis, and what can we offer women who won't leave their partners? https://t.co/977iyQO9hR

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I wish more faculty members would say whatever they actually think with clarity and precision, rather than indulging in hyperbole that does more to muddy and polarize than to clarify," @conor64 writes: https://t.co/F8e5ubVdd2

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The president hasn’t admitted publicly that he’s losing, of course. That sort of honesty—acknowledging that he might be anything other than a winner or a 'killer'—is too much of a humiliation for him,"@qjurecic and @benjaminwittes write: https://t.co/uqt0rPgcrK

name: TheAtlantic
text: Joe Kennedy hasn’t come up with a good rationale for challenging progressive Senator Ed Markey in Massachusetts. But with a name like his, it may not matter, @russellberman writes: https://t.co/cV92CM3ez6

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @jemelehill: The early returns show Major League Baseball’s disastrous return is ominous sign for college football and the NFL. My column for the @TheAtlantic https://t.co/vy6gpEczKz

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Teachers signed up to be a positive adult presence in children’s lives, and to help them grow up with their peers, at school, away from home. We need them to follow through, even though it’s a challenge," Kristen McConnell writes: https://t.co/cDGzBh1kbd

name: TheAtlantic
text: “If we lock them away with no trial, we make them living martyrs. If we make the boneheaded decision to execute them, then they become dead martyrs.” The families of ISIS's victims are asking for justice, @gcaw reports: https://t.co/MlLdMpSBUn

name: TheAtlantic
text: The photographer Adraint Khadafhi Bereal created “The Black Yearbook” to show the highs and lows of Black life at a predominantly white college, @AdamHSays writes. https://t.co/HRkZBYugXQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: With resources stretched thin during the coronavirus pandemic, nonprofits need to engage millennials and Gen Z effectively in order to survive and grow, writes @GLPerl of @SalesforceOrg https://t.co/V9tMWkaVLT

name: TheAtlantic
text: Los Angeles has an ambitious program to use tree-planting as an axis to connect job-creation, climate sustainability, urban renewal, and economic equity and inclusion, @JamesFallows writes: https://t.co/Vwij9e7utW

name: TheAtlantic
text: The shockwave from a massive blast in the port area of Beirut, Lebanon, destroyed buildings close by and shattered glass for miles around, causing at least 10 deaths and hundreds of injuries. Some early images from the aftermath: https://t.co/6Epkd7XjMe https://t.co/ispJWo0KLB

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YasmeenSerhan: Devastating images from today's explosion in Beirut https://t.co/Mb6pLTYY14

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @gcaw: If someone tortured and murdered your child, would you have the fortitude and grace to demand that no violence be done to them in return?

Two members of ISIS are in custody, and four American families are demanding justice, not blood: https://t.co/LvRR6p3pve

name: TheAtlantic
text: Cases will wax and wane over time, but this virus is never going away, @sarahzhang writes: https://t.co/bOSOtu8V1u

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @marinakoren: A reminder that at the end of the day, Bob and Doug are BFFs who went on one hell of a road trip https://t.co/c3tpKUkYdM
